keyword: how many calories in a sweet potato fries
title: How Many Calories in Sweet Potato Fries?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a sweet potato fries serving, including carbs, protein, fat, and nutrition tweaks for baked or fried versions.
h1: How Many Calories in Sweet Potato Fries?
assumptions: One serving = 100 g oven-baked sweet potato fries with 1 tsp oil, lightly salted; medium-sized sweet potatoes, no added sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by preparation (baked vs. fried), oil amount, portion size, and brand; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One serving (100 g) of oven-baked sweet potato fries provides ~195 kcal and ~25 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a serving of sweet potato fries?
faqs.a: About 195 kcal for 100 g oven-baked sweet potato fries.

faqs.q: Are sweet potato fries healthier than regular fries?
faqs.a: Yes, they have more fiber (3.5 g per 100 g) and vitamins, but calories depend on oil used.

faqs.q: What's the carb content in sweet potato fries?
faqs.a: Around 25 g carbs per 100 g serving, mostly from natural starches.

faqs.q: Do sweet potato fries have protein?
faqs.a: Minimal, about 2 g per 100 g; pair with protein sources for balance.

faqs.q: How does frying affect calories in sweet potato fries?
faqs.a: Frying adds oil, increasing calories by 50-100 kcal per 100 g compared to baking.
